definitions.definition: put down, especially gently or carefully.
examples: she laid the baby in his crib
synonyms: plunk "Curtis laid the newspaper on the table"

definitions.definition: prevent (something) from rising off the ground.
examples: there may have been the odd light shower just to lay the dust

definitions.definition: put down and set in position for use.
examples: it is advisable to have your carpet laid by a professional
synonyms: establish "the act laid the foundation for the new system"

definitions.definition: set cutlery, crockery, and mats on (a table) in preparation for a meal.
examples: she laid the table for the evening meal

definitions.definition: cover (a surface) with objects or a substance.
examples: the floor was laid with tiles

definitions.definition: make ready (a trap) for someone.
examples: she wouldn't put it past him to lay a trap for her
synonyms: bait "we laid the trap and waited"

definitions.definition: put the material for (a fire) in place and arrange it.
work out (an idea or suggestion) in detail ready for use or presentation.
examples: I'd like more time to lay my plans
synonyms: cook up "we laid out plans for the next voyage"

definitions.definition: present information or suggestions to be considered and acted upon by (someone).
examples: he laid before the House proposals for the establishment of the committee
synonyms: file "they are going to lay charges"

definitions.definition: locate (an episode in a play, novel, etc.) in a certain place.
examples: no one who knew the area could be in doubt where the scene was laid

definitions.definition: follow (a specified course).
go or come.
examples: they had to lay aloft

definitions.definition: stake (an amount of money) in a wager.
examples: she suspected he was pulling her leg, but she wouldn't have laid money on it
synonyms: speculate "I'll lay money that Michelle will be there"

definitions.definition: used with an abstract noun so that the phrase formed has the same meaning as the verb related to the noun used, e.g., “lay the blame on” means ‘to blame’
examples: she laid great stress on little courtesies

definitions.definition: (of a female bird, insect, reptile, or amphibian) produce (an egg) from inside the body.
examples: flamingos lay only one egg

definitions.definition: have sexual intercourse with.
the general appearance of an area, including the direction of streams, hills, and similar features.
examples: the lay of the surrounding countryside

definitions.definition: the position or direction in which something lies.
examples: roll the carpet against the lay of the nap

definitions.definition: the direction or amount of twist in rope strands.
an act of sexual intercourse.
a person with a particular ability or availability as a sexual partner.
the laying of eggs or the period during which they are laid.
not ordained into or belonging to the clergy.
examples: a lay preacher

definitions.definition: not having professional qualifications or expert knowledge, especially in law or medicine.
examples: lay and professional views of medicine

definitions.definition: a short lyric or narrative poem meant to be sung.
a song.
examples: on his lips there died the cheery lay

definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) be in or assume a horizontal or resting position on a supporting surface.
examples: the man lay face downward on the grass
synonyms: loll "he was lying on a bed"

definitions.definition: (of a thing) rest flat on a surface.
examples: a book lay open on the table
synonyms: rest "her handbag lay on a chair"

definitions.definition: (of a dead person) be buried in a particular place.
be, remain, or be kept in a specified state.
examples: the church lies in ruins today

definitions.definition: (of something abstract) reside or be found.
examples: the solution lies in a return to “traditional family values.”
synonyms: reside "the difficulty lies in building real quality into the products"

definitions.definition: (of a place) be situated in a specified position or direction.
examples: the small town of Swampscott lies about ten miles north of Boston
synonyms: be sited "lying on the border of Switzerland and Austria"

definitions.definition: (of a scene) extend from the observer's viewpoint in a specified direction.
examples: stand here, and all of Amsterdam lies before you

definitions.definition: (of an action, charge, or claim) be admissible or sustainable.
